globalMetadata.title: Good Thinking - NHS approved wellbeing service
globalMetadata.description: Anxious, stressed, depressed or having trouble sleeping? Find NHS-approved mental health tools and advice to support you.

attributes.alternativeText: Group of friends sitting on grass in front of London skyline
attributes.name: OG Image.png

footer.description: Good Thinking provides a range of resources to help Londoners improve their mental wellbeing.

subscribeFooterText.copy: Get the latest tips and resources for Londoners delivered to your inbox every month.

partners.name: Transformation Partners in Health and Care

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Find support, advice and resources by:

  • Mental health concern

Sleep, Anxiety, Low mood, Stress.

  • Audience

Young people, Employers and employees, Someone who is grieving, Faith and belief communities.

  • Type of support

Self-assessments, quick quizzes, free apps, podcasts, videos, how to guides, workbooks.

Get expert advice from Good Thinking

The Good Thinking team has created a broad range of advice in collaboration with clinical and subject-area experts, designed to support Londoners with everyday mental health challenges.

In our Latest Advice section, you'll find short guides with tips and resource recommendations to help you with a range of concerns including dealing with uncertainty, money worries, getting enough sleep and coping with bereavement. 

If you’re looking for advice on a specific subject, type in your topic in the ‘search﻿’ box at the top of the page.

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Use the Good Thinking self-assessment tool

Our in-depth, clinically validated self-assessments are a thorough assessment of both your mental and physical wellbeing. They may seem quite ‘medical’ because they are based on the types of questions a doctor or a psychologist might ask you.

  • Each self-assessment takes around 20 minutes to complete
  • Answer questions about yourself or someone you may be concerned about
  • You’ll get a personalised list of recommended actions to take forward

howToUseSection.bodyText:
Take the Good Thinking quiz

Take one of our quizzes on anxiety, sleep, low mood and stress.

Answer three simple questions, such as “How often are you affected by this?”, and you’ll then receive personalised recommendations for apps and other resources to help you.

tabs.title: Good Thinking Communications Toolkit
tabs.content:
This toolkit contains information about the Good Thinking service. It will support you in raising awareness of the free, personalised advice, and NHS-approved apps and resources available through our website to help support positive mental health and wellbeing across your network and within your local community:

  • Good Thinking Communications Toolkit

tabs.title: Printable flyers, posters and guides
tabs.content:
Flyers and posters

  • Good Thinking flyer
  • Good Thinking poster 1 (A4)
  • Good Thinking poster 2 (A4)
  • Good Thinking poster 3 (A4)
  • Good Thinking poster 4 (A4)
  • Good Thinking poster 1 (A3)
  • Good Thinking poster 2 (A3)

One page guides

The one page guides can be used to help point people to the right resources according to their need, and are available for adults and children and young people:

  • Good Thinking support information one pagers - adults
  • Good Thinking support information one pagers - children and young people

tabs.title: Further information about Good Thinking
tabs.content:
• Good Thinking Introduction presentation (PowerPoint)
  • Introduction to Good Thinking webinar 16th March 2022

tabs.title: Employer Toolkit
tabs.content:
Looking for new ways to support your employees’ wellbeing? This toolkit will support you in raising awareness of the free, personalised advice, and NHS-approved apps and resources available through Good Thinking to help promote positive mental health and wellbeing in the workplace.

  • Employer Toolkit

tabs.title: Student Mental Health Communications Toolkits
tabs.content:
The end of the summer holidays can bring anxiety and stress for many young Londoners. The move to a new year at school, college or university, transition to further or higher education and worries about academic achievement may have an impact on their mental wellbeing. 

  • Our Student mental health communications toolkit contains information about the Good Thinking Student Mental Health Hub (content suitable for those in further and higher education), and highlights other services and resources which students, parents and carers and education sector staff may find helpful as students return to school, college and university.
  • Our Student mental health: secondary school and further education communications toolkit contains information about Good Thinking’s advice and support for young Londoners, tailored for those at secondary school and in further education (college and sixth form).

tabs.title: Mental Health Awareness Week 2023
tabs.content:
This year’s Mental Health Awareness Week takes place from 15 to 21 May 2023. The week is run by the Mental Health Foundation, which started it in 2001. The theme for the week this year is anxiety.

This toolkit contains information about the Good Thinking service and its advice and support for anxiety. It will support you in raising awareness of the free, personalised advice, and NHS-approved apps and resources available through our website to help support positive mental health and wellbeing across your network and within your local community:

  • Good Thinking’s anxiety communications guide

tabs.title: Five ways to wellbeing & Children and Young People
tabs.content:
Good Thinking has worked with the Partnership for Young London to develop the 5 Ways to Wellbeing for Children & Young People.

  • 5 Ways to Wellbeing for Children & Young People
  • Five ways to wellbeing & CYP Communications Toolkit

This campaign toolkit contains information about the Five Ways to Wellbeing for Children and Young People resources and will support you in raising awareness of mental health and wellbeing within your local community.

The toolkit includes:

  • an introduction to the Good Thinking digital mental wellbeing service;
  • a link to the Five Ways to Wellbeing for Children and Young People resource for you to share online or print as needed;
  • a newsletter/bulletin article for you to use to raise awareness of the resource within your community;
  • social media content for you to use to promote the toolkit to your community on your Twitter, Instagram and Facebook pages. You can also tag us in @GoodThinkingUK

We’d appreciate your support in promoting this campaign to improve mental health and wellbeing across London.

If you have any questions, please contact the Good Thinking team at Info@good-thinking.uk

tabs.title: Supporting children & young people's mental health over winter
tabs.content:
For children and young people in London facing many challenges such as social and academic pressures and cost of living worries, the winter period can be challenging on their mental health.

The Children and Young People’s Mental Health Transformation team at Transformation Partners in Health and Care (TPHC) has put together this resource pack to help partners and local organisations support London’s children and young people over the winter months.

This toolkit contains  information and resources produced by TPHC and key partners in London for local authorities, schools/colleges, and community/third-sector organisations on different mental health services and support which is available for children and young people, and their parents and carers.

We hope these resources help you to direct children and young people, and their parents/carers to the appropriate support for their mental wellbeing, whether they are looking for tips to help cope through different situations, are awaiting treatments or interventions for a specific condition, or need urgent crisis support.

Download the toolkit by clicking on the link below.

  • Supporting children & young people's mental health over the winter months

contentSections.content:
Faith and belief communities toolkits

In recognition of London being the most religiously diverse region of England, Good Thinking has collaborated with members of eight faith and belief communities to develop bespoke wellbeing resources.

We've created a range of communications toolkits that can be used by faith leaders, community and council representatives, GPs and members of the public to raise awareness of the support offered to faith communities by Good Thinking.

tabs.title: Buddhism and mental wellbeing
tabs.content:
Good Thinking have worked in collaboration with members of London’s Buddhist communities, with the support of The Buddhist Society and in consultation with the Network of Buddhist Organisations to create a unique range of mental wellbeing resources that align with the beliefs and teachings of Buddhism.

Looking to help spread the word about Good Thinking and our Buddhism resources for Londoners in your organisation and community?

Simply download the free communications toolkit below for a full guide to support you with raising awareness; including copy, graphics and animations for social media, newsletters, bulletins and websites:

  • Mental wellbeing and Buddhism communications toolkit

tabs.title: Christianity and mental wellbeing
tabs.content:
Good Thinking have worked in collaboration with members of London’s Christian communities, with the support of the Church of England, The Catholic Church, Evangelical Alliance and Churches Together to create a unique range of mental wellbeing resources that align with the beliefs and teachings of Christianity.

Looking to help spread the word about Good Thinking and our Christianity resources for Londoners in your organisation and community?

Simply download the free communications toolkit below for a full guide to support you with raising awareness; including copy, graphics and animations for social media, newsletters, bulletins and websites:

Looking to help spread the word about Good Thinking and our Judaism resources for Londoners in your organisation and community?
